content: How are composite attributes handled when converting an ER model to relational tables?

content: When we convert ER to relation, one of the following is right?

options.label: A
options.content: In many-to-many relationship, post the primary key of the many side table to many side of another table as foreign key.

options.label: A
options.content: B.In one-to-one relationship, post the primary key of the partial participant table as a foreign key into the total participant table.

options.label: A
options.content: In one-to-many relationship, post the primary key of the many side table to one side table as foreign key.

options.label: D
options.content: In many-to-many relationship, create a single table with all attributes from both entities.

content: All 2nd year CS students are invited to comparing two sorting algorithms. Algorithm A has a time complexity of O(n2), and Algorithm B has a time complexity of O(nlogn)). For large input sizes, Algorithm B consistently runs faster than Algorithm A. why?

options.label: A
options.content: Algorithm A has a higher constant factor

options.label: A
options.content: B.	 O(n2), grows faster than O (nlogn) as n increases

options.label: A
options.content: Algorithm B uses less memory than Algorithm A

options.label: A
options.content: B.	 Continue searching the left half

options.label: A
options.content: Stop the search and conclude that the target is not in the array

content: Sort the Given array [8, 3, 7, 4, 6, 2, 5], using selection sort and selecting the first element as the  a smallest, what is the resulting array after the third iteration (pass)?
Given an array of identical elements, such as [7, 7, 7, 7, 7], and using Quick Sort with the first element as the pivot, what will happen during the partitioning step?

options.label: A
options.content: The entire array will be partitioned into one side, and the other side will be empty, causing unbalanced recursion

options.label: A
options.content: B.The algorithm will partition the array into multiple subarrays with distinct elements, resulting in a balanced recursion.

options.label: A
options.content: The pivot element will be moved to the correct position, and the algorithm will recurse on the two non-empty subarrays.

options.label: D
options.content: The algorithm will swap the identical elements, but they will not be separated into subarrays, leading to infinite recursion.

content: How does Selection Sort behave when the array is already partially sorted?

options.label: A

options.label: A
options.content: B.	It still performs O(n2) comparisons because it does not take advantage of any existing order.

options.label: A
options.content: It requires additional memory to maintain the sorted portion.

options.label: D
options.content: It adjusts its strategy to avoid making swaps.
